New Records: Juan Soto hit a home run in the 10th inning, tying the game and sending the Yankees to the World Series for the 41st time in franchise history
Key Match Events: The game went into 10 innings with Juan Soto's home run in the bottom of the 10th inning securing the Yankees' victory
Giancarlo Stanton hit a game-tying home run in the top of the 7th inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees made a high-risk decision by trading for Juan Soto, which paid off with his crucial home run
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees' bullpen performed well, with Mark Leiter Jr., Tim Hill, Jake Cousins, and Luke Weaver holding the Guardians off the scoreboard
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first World Series appearance for the Yankees since 2009
The Yankees will face either the Dodgers or Mets in the Fall Classic
